Reviews.Title: “Art Gallery type lobby”
Reviews.Author: Constantine17
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Dallas for a one day overnight trip and stayed at the Hilton Lincoln Center. The hotel is typical of what you would expect from a Hilton. Clean rooms, comfortable beds, typically business ammenities. The lobby is reminiscent of an art gallery or museum. Marble floors, open spaces, lots of glass. It is very well situtated, just off of I-635 and across the street from the Galleria. The only downside, and I find the same thing a most of the nicer hotels I stay at, is the fact that WIFI access has a daily charge. Parking is also a bit of a challenge as you have to park across the street at the parking garage and walk over.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TeamDavis
Reviews.Content: This place is in an AWESOME location! It is right on 635 and across the freeway from the Galleria mall. Note that parking at the hotel is $14 per night, and it is charged directly to your room. The rooms are pretty standard in size and the amenities are great. Staff is friendly and helpful, and the property is kept clean. We even received a free upgrade to the executive levels! Overall a nice and quiet hotel, bed was super comfy (as are most Hiltons) Got a great deal for this hotel on Priceline, so be cautious of paying market rates online, worth it I am sure, but why pay it if you have other options...

Reviews.Title: “Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: trackaprint
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, however, if you are flying into Dallas Airport to this hotel, you will may want to consider renting a car for your personal use. Also if you are not interested in renting your own vehicle, the hotel also provides complimentary shuttle within a 5 mile radius of the hotel and with the area you have quite a few other hotels, restaurants, banking, Galleria Mall, and more.

Reviews.Title: “Updated rooms, Comfy beds, Skip the Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KSinSBC
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a wonderful stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms and bathrooms were updated and very comfortable (modern by classy), and the blackout curtains were greatly appreciated along with the dual outlets on lamps. But the vanity area needs a vanity mirror with lamp (the ottoman suggests that I am suppose to apply makeup there, but the lighting is way too dark). There is also a large bank of elevators which is great for when the hotel is at capacity. Speaking of which, the halls were surprisingly quite (well, minimal noise) for supposedly being at capacity on a Saturday night. Make sure you check your directions if you are driving (our GPS landed us about 1/2 a mile or so away) and skip breakfast at Crockett's unless you are confined to the hotel. It's 2 star hotel quality for a 5 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Way overrated! Not a 4 star.. More like 2.5 at best”
Reviews.Author: Dallasational
Reviews.Content: I am so dissappointed in The Hilton chain. First off how is it that you consider yourselves a 4 star and supposedly a convention center at this particular location and yet you are charging $13 per Day for Wi/-Fi??.. That is Outrageous!! Shouldn't providing free or at least affordable access to business tools be a part of boasting a business friendly atmosphere.?? .. And dont tell me about becoming a HH honors member because first off I don't travel to the extent where i would build up hotel points like that ( So what if I'm the little guy, and not some big whig with a limitless budget) That shouldn't matter. We were there for 8 days the Internet alone would've cost us $104! I don't pay that much for a month's worth at home!!.. And On top of the cost of our stay. Which was well over $800 even on Priceiline.. at those prices plus $13 per day to self park or $23 per day for valet , certainly providing free WI-FI wouldn't break the Hilton hotel bank! And if you are going to pretend to conpete with the real 4 star hotels please replace those old Dell computers in your business center.. And as another reviewer wrote the noise in this hotel was beyond reasonable.. One night I had to call the front desk because something kept slamming really hard right outside our door. It stopped scout an hour later but I continued to hear it off and on throughout the other nights and some mornings even..during the remainder of our stay. So I can only assume that it was those loud doors on each room. And housekeeping is so loud in the morning it's ridiculous!! There was noise every morning both over our heads and outside our door, starting at around 7 am.:( Now, finally and ( only because I am tired of typing and not because I don't have anything else to do or more to say) last but not least let me not forget the dingy towels. I mean come'on Hilton. I know your little signs in the bathroom about saving water and being energy efficient and earth friendly are cute and all, but really ??...who do you think you are fooling,? Certainly not your guest, we know the profits you retain from not replacing or washing as many go back into your pockets. But for cleanliness and customer satisfaction sake, I strongly suggest that you invest in some new ones and instruct your housekeeping staff to replace them when white begins to appear gray :(., .. That being said, I wish i had followed my first mind and chose a Marriott.. Annd,, I am certainly glad that the rest of my first trip to Dallas turned out well because my stay at your hotel was certainly not the highlight of it:( Sincerely, an unsatisfied guest,

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: Incisive_Idiot
Reviews.Content: The staff is generally good here, but otherwise I wouldn't recommend it; the property just seems tired. E.g. my iron leaked all over my shirt, the sink sometimes puts out extremely hot water even with the valve over to Cold, you can't adjust the resistance of one of the two elliptical machines in the gym, etc. Also, the walls and doors are exceptionally thin. I could hear people extremely clearly in the hall, hear normal conversation levels and phones ringing in the next rooms, etc. Luckily I didn't have noisy neighbors...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mom2toopreciouskids
Reviews.Content: First I want to preface this by saying we got our rooms here through Priceline "name your own price" so we got a REALLY good deal. It is very clean and nicely decorated. I had seen some reviews complaining about bathroom size and I personally thought the rooms were just fine and spacious. We had a great view too. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. My disappointments were having to pay for parking! 14 dollars a night, the housekeeping staff knocking on our door before 8:00 to see if they could clean and no heated pool or indoor pool. So I probably would not come back unless I got another discounted room or I was here on business. Seemed like a great place for a conference!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: rwueste
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews from yelp I wasn't expecting much. We had a great stay and a free upgrade to the executive floor that has free breakfast. The rooms were big and nicely done, even if they were a bit outdated. Not outdated much...probably chic 80s Dallas style.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: NolaHal
Reviews.Content: The Lincoln Centre Hotel is impressive, if not charming. I would not hesitate to return, if I found myself in this part of Dallas again. My room was comfortable, with plenty of light. I had an in-room safe, an extremely large desk, and an enormous shower. Room service one night was a bit slower-than-promised (45 rather than 35 minutes), but the food was good and the service itself very good. The hotel's fitness room is in an interesting spot architecturally, but contained only two eliptical machines, one of which was broken the two days I was there. However, for $5 one could purchase a day pass in Lincoln Centre gym, in the next building. Freeway noise was constant, but--perhaps because of the enormous water feature, which was large enough to attract migrating ducks--not as loud as at other freeway-side hotels where I've spent the night. All in all, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Faceless”
Reviews.Author: G-Money-TX
Reviews.Content: Bland, faceless hotel in an isolated location. Poor wine list. Average service. Average rooms. The diplomat suite did not even have an in-room safe. One should expect more from this type of room. The club level lounge was never open, and the internet access was not free. Overall, average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Yellowrose831
Reviews.Content: I came to Dallas for a 2 day jammed conference. There were nightly mixers and dinners in addition to the conference. My itinerary was full from morning until late night. My room was a great escape to the day's activities. I had the most comfortable bed. I was welcomed every morning with a newspaper and in room coffee. I appreciated the disposable travel cups that let me take my coffee with me to enjoy on my way to the conference across the highway. The rooms are extremely insulated and noise from the hallway is eliminated. A perfect place to spend while on business. My only complaint is that hotel guests are required to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Still nice after all these years”
Reviews.Author: Lstew55
Reviews.Content: I was there for a work related awards banquet - I had not ever been to this location as a Hilton property - The last time I had been here, it was still a DoubleTree - it was obvious there had been recent money spent to upgrade the TVs, the carpets, the drapes, the sheets - BTW, softest towels EVER - very nice soaps, etc. in the bathroom - VERY small bathroom - but serviceable - sound carried way too much so if anyone shut a door in the hallway, you knew it - same way about conversations in the hallway - but overall, still a nice place to stay (I thought the beds were too hard, but my travel companion said they were JUST RIGHT - so guess it is all a matter of preference)

Reviews.Title: “poor service need new management. very small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Harleybabe03
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hilton for the location but it had been the worst Hilton as far as service is. I had to wait a long time just to get my luggage brought up. it seems they have a shortage of help. At 4:30 when I returned after working that day and my room still was not cleaned. the next day they did not even leave me clean towels and no coffee. when I requested the items the only brought me coffee for on cup and said they were running short Trying to get drinks. at the bar the bartender Was too busy texting.

Reviews.Title: “OK to stay”
Reviews.Author: hi0422
Reviews.Content: Good Hilton. We stayed for family short vacation and it was much more comfortable than Embassy Suites on Stemmons freeway which was dated and noisy in the room. The bad thing for this hotel was that some towels were very old so I did not feel like using. Since we were tirerd we gave up going out to the best restaurant in Dallas so we had a room service for dinner: the taste was average compared to other Hilton's. P.S. my best room menu of Hilton was Los Cabos, MX.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect rest - not just for business travelers!”
Reviews.Author: jamibc
Reviews.Content: The family wanted to do something a bit different this Christmas, so decided to take a li'l road trip to Dallas. Because of hubby's travel points through work, this hotel made our short list & we were very glad we chose it. Although it's probably more business travel oriented, the staff was exemplary, the rooms (entire location, actually) were immaculate & location was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hilton”
Reviews.Author: FPodesta
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few Hiltons that I've stayed in the US which lacks the "I was built in the 80's" feel. The decor is quite nice. The rooms are large, and the bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. The entire hotel is clean and it has the most efficient staff that I've ever experienced at a Hilton. Parking is across the street in a garage, and is not exactly convenient. Getting to the hotel from the highway can be trouble. High floors have a nice view of Dallas. The hotel is a bit further outside of Dallas than one would like, but it is very convenient to a number of business/convention centers, and is located right off the beltway.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas Lincoln Center Hitlon”
Reviews.Author: TexasAg69
Reviews.Content: Average Hilton Hotel. Valet parking an additional $22.00/day. I qualify for Executive Level with free breakfast in the "Executive Lounge". Nobody told us "Lounge" was being remodeled and the temporary location was not on our floor. Ice machine did not work on our floor. Staff very friendly and accomodating. The bathroom sink and bath drains in our newly remodeled room ran very slowly. I have stayed at this property several times and it beginning to show its age despite the remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Still working out the kinks?”
Reviews.Author: DCMcG
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel is in the middle of a major renovation, and that may have something to do with the things that bothered me about this stay. Overall the hotel looks nice and has plenty of ammenities to offer. I only spent one night, before flying out of DFW recently. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: The hotel and lobby are beautiful. The hotel looks and feels luxurious, and is decorated well. The lobby has several bars and eateries, and places just to hang out. The staff is friendly and helpful. The concierge was great, reccommended and made us a reservation at a lovely steakhouse. The hotel shuttle is convenient and the driver was really interesting and funny. The rooms are HUGE and brand new. The decorations and furnishing are not the normal drab Hilton stuff, but actually look like a designer was in the room. Our room had two flat screen TVs, and the bedroom was seperated by a half wall where the living room and kitchen were. Bathroom was separate with a walk in dressing area. The bathroom itself was quite small, however. Cons: The biggest con is the sleep quality. The fan in the room made a loud woosh/clicking noise every time it turned on or off, which woke me up about every hour. Then, between 3 and 4 AM, the people in the room next to us were so loud that both my husband and I woke up and couldn't get back to sleep. They were coming and going from the room so we could hear the door slam repeatedly. We could hear everything that was said in the hallway, and we could even hear loud talking through the wall. This is surprising because if you remember how our room was set up, our neighbors were on the far side by the living room, away from the bed, and behind another half wall. It was by far the loudest night I've ever spent in a hotel. When we complained the next morning we were told we were the first people to ever stay in the room and they would look into the air duct noise. We were offered complimentary parking as consolation for the noisy neighbors. The other dissapointment here is the executive lounge. As Hilton Diamond members, I've seen some great perks and lounges in various hotels. The week we stayed the lounge was under going renovation, so was temporarily moved to a small conference room. There was no view, and limited seating. The food that was offered in the evening was good and appreciated. However no free drinks is a bit of a disappointment. We ended up just going to the bar in the lobby for a drink, since the ambiance was much better. You must pay to use the business center. I believe there was free wireless, but since I was travelling without a computer, I had no access without paying. Average: Gym is small but great selection of equipment. It was full, but I was able to use what I wanted. Parking fees are average. Breakfast at the hotel was good, nothing to rave about. Overall, the sleep quality at this hotel made it really miserable for me. But, I do believe this could be a great property once the kinks are worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton”
Reviews.Author: PShermanATL
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hilton with an extremly nice staff. The room was clean, but I had no room service menu and it was late so I ate a snack from my bag and went to bed. The executive lounge had a nice breakfast. The gym was small, and at 6:30am every machine was taken. But overall, it was a good hotel! Very close to Dallas Galleria and they drove me saving me the cab fare.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price for adults”
Reviews.Author: bilboinsa
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of days over Thanksgiving at the hotel. Pros--clean, safe and great location. Also scored a great deal on Expedia at $80 a night. Terrific deal for this location of Dallas. Cons were no fridge in room, no vent/heater in bathroom, and very little for kids to do for fun. This is a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: welovedancing
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was large and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business hotel in the heart of the business district”
Reviews.Author: arao24
Reviews.Content: Hilton Dallas Lincoln center is an exceptional business hotel in the heart of the business area- off LBJ freeway. It is a huge one with its own large banquet and conference halls.There are multiple restuarants too and the duck pool with the fountain is enchanting.A grab away lunch by the pool is just what you need to be refereshed in the middle of a hectic business day.Only complaint is about the restuarants- including Starbucks which close by 3 pm:( Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “They redeemed theirselves”
Reviews.Author: Abbigale E
Reviews.Content: I had recently written a review on this hotel and it was a bad experience, but the manager, Ana, contacted me and gave us a free night and free breakfast. The room we were in was renovated and was very nice. Our stay was definitely more pleasant and relaxing. The breakfast was awesome!!! Thanks Ana for making it a wonderful evening.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: paula t
Reviews.Content: wow this hotel was amazing. although we only stayed for a coupple of nights we wanted to stay more. the staff were so helpful and the facilities like a gym and large swimming pool was really good. the room were an ok size but the beds were so comfy and everything was so clean and well kept! there is a free shuttle from the hotel to shopping malls and its a very luxurious shuttle. this hotel is very well priced and i would highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel, get a refurbished room though”
Reviews.Author: Karen7
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel, picked for a five night stay in Dallas. It's near the Galleria mall, though not attached to it like the Westin is, and we were advised you could only drive and not walk there, which is a shame given the convoluted and often hairy freeways around Dallas! Oddly, they have refurbished rooms from the bottom floor up, meaning the executive levels are still old. We'd seen here on Tripadvisor a recommendation to get a new room so asked for ours to be swapped and boy it was worth it. The new rooms are very stylish and a good size, though the bathroom was small. The staff here are great- the executive lounge staff were friendly and funny, the front desk staff really helpful and Randy the valet worked his socks off! The only small minus point is the location as you have to drive to do anything or get dinner etc (though its own restaurant was good), and the pool is almost always in the shade so we didn't get to soak up the rays in the unusual late summer heat

Reviews.Title: “absolutely shocked!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley B
Reviews.Content: Wow, I can't believe I was able to book this hotel below $70 per night and got this experience. The rooms are a renovated "boutique modern french" and were clean and comfortable in every way. The room was not huge, but was fine because I do not require a bunch of dead space. The bathroom was lovely as well. It was not perfect as there were a couple of places where the grout was coming off the new tile job. The bed was extremely comfortable although they could upgrade the pillows( I brought my own firm down pillow). I am an extremely discriminating traveler and have stayed at the Mansion and Crescent, and this hotel was absolutely fine and MUCH more. Otis, a manager, personally brought us an Iphone charger, and James in security mailed us our items we left in the closet at NO charge! We did not have dinner here but our breakfast was excellent and the valet service was good. Amazing deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for North Dallas business area - nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: dfndr
Reviews.Content: I have always liked this location for its excellent location and good rooms at moderate rates. The rooms are being renovated. They are doing a good job of keeping the ongoing renovation from impacting guests. I would have known it was happening if I hadn't mentioned the new lobby to the front desk clerk. I asked for one of the newly renovated rooms and got won. The new rooms are very upscale, although I found the decor to be somewhat fru-fru. I recommend this property as a better value alternative to the Westin Galleria hotel. The hotel has a deal with the adjacent Lincoln Centre Fitness Club which is far superior to the closet sized gyms found in most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Abbigale E
Reviews.Content: We had so many problems with this hotel, and its not been our first with the Hilton chain. We paid for executive level and got a room on the 6th floor. When there was a frat party going on all night I went and asked to be moved closer to the 18th floor, the executive level. We got a room on the 16th floor which included stained bedding and carpet. The entire building is non smoking but apparently this excludes the 16th floor which smelled like a big ashtray. By paying more for the executive level, you are entitled to a few perks like the lounge which has snacks, water and breakfast... your room key is supposed to be the only way you can get to the lounge, but in this hotel everyone can go there and get these things so why did I pay more??? The bed was very firm, which i know is my own personal issue. Some lower level rooms have been remodeled, but the upper level ones are still stuck in the 90's. If I had it to do again, I'd stay at the Comfort Suites before I ever stayed here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 86jacket
Reviews.Content: The accommodations and room was excellent. Staff was very friendly. Stayed there for a business meeting this week and it was really nice. Relatively short drive to Love Field. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: tdl119
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here for the first time this week. Being a Hilton HHonors Gold member, I received an upgrade to the Executive Level. The room was very nice (flat screen TV, A/C worked great) and the snacks in the Executive lounge were good. The breakfast buffet at Crockett's was excellent, The thing that impressed me the most was the very friendly and professional service that I received from everyone with whom I interacted; from LaVaul Taylor (Executive Concierge), to the desk clerks, restaurant servers, parking valets. This is usually a good indication that a property is well-managed and that people enjoy working there. If you need a very nice hotel in this part of Dallas, I don't think that you can find anything better at anywhere near this price-point.

Reviews.Title: “A Very nice upscale hotel for a cheap price!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chanman85
Reviews.Content: Our son had a blast at the pool and met new friends while we enjoyed refreshments from the hotel's bar. We also got to enjoy the room of the newly renovated wing of the hotel. It still had the new smell. The room service was great!! ...This is a 100% smoke free hotel though. :(

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: lmeegan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice proximity to all sorts of restaurants which is a really good thing, since the restaurant onsite isn't much to talk about. It has some pedestrian fare, but with so many steakhouses and italian restaurants close by, it's better to get the hotel shuttle to give you a ride to where you want to go. The concierge was very helpful with recommendations. The rooms were nice, although I stayed in a suite on the 12th floor and it smelled like paint pretty strongly (couldn't really figure out why since nothing appeared to be painted fresh). The rooms were clean and big, beds comfy, with all the stuff you need. The staff throughout the hotel was very friendly, and will greet you almost everywhere you go. The bar was nice as well, although the only food choices are standard fried bar fare. The internet connection through the hotel seemed inconsistent through the 4 days i stayed there, was good signal in the bar, ok in my room, not so good in the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: micarooni
Reviews.Content: The common areas and my room were attractive and clean. The tub was large and there was room in the bathroom and closet to spread my things out. My window looked over the pool area. The workout room was very nice and also looked out at the pool. I ate a salad in the bar one night and that was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Service”
Reviews.Author: HiltonSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel whether staying on business or pleasure. Standout of the hotel is the EXCEPTIONALLY friendly and accomodating staff. Great food, great service, and beautiully renovated rooms. Would definitely recommend to anyone staying in the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sorrels13
Reviews.Content: Booked it on their site along with airfare and car rental, got a super price. Saved about $350 versus booking each one individually. The hotel was very nice, the staff was super nice and friendly. Great location but not much around it. Right next to 635 and the Tollway so it was easy getting around town. The breakfast was pretty good, room service was really good but way overpriced. The room was extremely nice, very comfortable bed and nice TV. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: savvytravelingmom
Reviews.Content: Extremely low quality for a 4-star hotel. Stained carpet, stained bedding, extremely outdated bathroom that bordered on unclean (the bathroom door was disgusting, there was an inch of dust on the toilet paper holder, dirty grout in the shower, and caulk everywhere), a TV remote that didn't work, and a TV that made a high-pitched noise every time we turned it on. Checked in around 9:30 on Friday night (which was easy, front desk was friendly). We were jolted from our sleep around midnight, and off and on for the next 2 hours by loud hotel guests roaming the halls. We left the room at 9:15 on Saturday morning and returned right after 3:00 pm to let the kids rest, to find that housekeeping had never made it to our room. Frustrating, because at that point, the kids needed a nap. I didn't call the front desk, what difference would it have made at that point? I saw the manager mention renovations in earlier posts...I saw no evidence of that. Overall huge disappointment. My first true "bust" using Priceline. This hotel's star level needs to be knocked down a notch in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: strongea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a trip to Dallas. My husband and I were going on a little night away from the kids! I chose the romantic package and I know I paid a little more, but it was worth it! They upgraded us to the Exec floor and the room was very nice, the staff even nicer! They had bubbly and choc covered strawberries delivered about 30 minutes after we arrived. The Breakfast which was included in our package was wonderful! The buffet ($18.00) was great! Scrambled eggs, meat, fruits, pancakes, oatmeal, cerals, juice and lots of extra. All made fresh! The wait staff was amazing! All in All I thought it was a great stay and would go back again. Also on a note the morning we were departing I saw a Dad and son playing in the pool and it was a very nice pool with kid depth! They looked like they were having a grand time! Valet Parking $22, self parking $13. Internet not sure we did not use it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, media center needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: stasta1
Reviews.Content: Great location and value for the price. The lobby area was great for entertaining. The guest room was clean and cozy. Room service was prompt. Customer service personnel appeared knowledgable about the hotel and surrounding area. The draw backs were: once we turned the television on black lines ran across the screen and we couldn't understand the vocals. Parking was $15.00 per day. once the guest room media centers are updated, I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond what?”
Reviews.Author: Travelsal0t1
Reviews.Content: I travel almost exclusively with Hilton and have Diamond "status." Each time I stay here I am less and less excited about the service and the room. There are no extras for loyalty so I can't imagine the experience of a non "status" traveler. My room type request was not accommodated. There was a big stain on the carpet when I entered the room. Bathrooms need upgrades. Valet was fast and the lunch buffet was good. The new toiletries were nice. With the onset of a 5 year construction project on 635 and this mediocre attitude, I will be looking for another hotel for my Dallas business trips.

Reviews.Title: “just average rooms”
Reviews.Author: dbb4216
Reviews.Content: service varies from a 5 score to 1 score, depends who you meet. Front desk service is almost non exsistence. Bar and resturant has good service, what you expect from a good business hotel. location is great. rooms are very average, need some repair and maintainence. still tube TV's, no flat screens??? needs leadership to wake up and get with the programme.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay during a corporate meeting”
Reviews.Author: Frostdsnoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a training session. Very nice beds but di understand the rooms are undergoing a refreshing this summer. Location us pretty convenient for travel with a large mall minutes away. Food quality was above average for our buffet offerings each day. Very nice and welcoming lobby area that really comes alive with guests in the evening. Wish the pool was heated, but still worked well for some laps.

Reviews.Title: “Location=awful. Lobby=beautiful. Rooms=apparently getting updated soon.”
Reviews.Author: itzMS
Reviews.Content: The intial impressions of this hotel are equivalent to "WOWWWW this is amazing!" and then you get to your room... The lobby is very typical of the updated large Hiltons...very modern, very calm, tons of seating/meeting area, trendy/courteous staff. The rooms leave a lot to be desired...in fact, many of the staff have seemed to automatically resort to telling guests that rooms will be updated "soon" so guests do not complain. Well, that's great you're up soon for a remodel, but it didn't help me at the time. At this point, the rooms are basically what you would have found in the mid-1990's. Aside from the bed, typical Hilton pillowtop (always nice). I think for the time being, the hotel management could have the engineering staff in those rooms after every guest to polish things up and at least give the appearance that the old hardware is well-maintained. The rooms really were lackluster. The location is also god-awful. Basically just a hotel in a business park. There is NOTHING within walking distance. Not even something as simple as a Walgreens or CVS. My coworker and I were warned by staff that it's not safe to walk anywhere in this particular area. We didn't ask if it was due to no sidewalks (near a major freeway) or due to other reasons. Therefore, if you do not have a car, you are at the mercy of the spotty service of the hotel shuttle (which really only takes people to the Galleria mall & back) or a taxi (super expensive.) I wouldn't stay here again until after the rooms are updated. Also, there would be no point to staying here without a car.

Reviews.Title: “I thought this hotel was nothing special!”
Reviews.Author: Sambamsucka
Reviews.Content: This hotel sucked! I expected such a nicer hotel experience with the name "Hilton". My room was nothing special at all, just standard. The bathrooms were old school & they charge you to park your own dang car! What a rip!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: pierreart
Reviews.Content: The best check-in and check-out procedure. Loved climbing into my king-sized bed and finding a handle on the bath tub designed for the physically challenged. When I ordered room service the food arrived promptly and hot, and the server was nothing less than very professional. Housekeeping followed my little notes left asking for less decaf in the coffee service area, and I had a most beautiful view from my room. Even the clerk in the gift shop was another gem to remember. Definitely staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: BamaBabe71
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with our visit At the Hilton Dallas Lincoln Center. I had read reviews that weren't that good... It is an older hotel, but I found it to be clean and well kept. They don't have flat LCD screen tvs, but seriously, who cares? I was bringing the tv home with me. Food was delicious and the lobby was very comfortable, cozy, relaxing and inviting. Indoor pool would have been nice, but we survivied without one.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Public Spaces - Rooms not so much”
Reviews.Author: familyfuntime
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the Hotel and public spaces are beautiful and elegant. The standard room will be a disappointment ... especially the bathroom. It is in much need of a remodel, upgrade or at least decent routine maintenance and spring cleaning. Please view pics for a clearer understanding.

Reviews.Title: “Better places in the area for the same price or cheaper”
Reviews.Author: Jbrewer227
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the weekend of 2/11-2/13 and the hotel looks really nice when you pull up and go into the lobby. That's when you find out you are going to pay $14/day to park your car. Seriously? I can stay at the intercontinental, Westin, or Omni and not have to pay to park my car. Then you get to your room. Very clean no issues there other then it looks like the last time it was updated was 1980. Nothing like watching TV on an old box TV when the shows that are being shown are in 16:9 widescreen format. That was nice...... Then you pay $13/day for internet access and it didn't work. I could not get online the help desk couldn't even get me online. Noone would give me a refund for this. The staff at the front desk is super nice i think the issue was just out of their hands. Getting to the hotel presents its issues also if you don't have a GPS and you aren't from the area good luck to you. I lived in Dallas for 2 years and had a hard time getting to the hotel for the first time. All in all if i had to recommend a hotel to a friend that wanted to stay in this area i would send them somewhere else. In the end this is not a 4 star hotel. If the rooms were updated it would be 4 star easily but its very dated and doesn't meet 4 star expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: norskvacationers
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before probably will not stay here again. I asked for a non-smoking single bed room away from the elevators. Upon arrival I was dismayed that my room was right next to the elevator and it was a double bed room. The bathroom was dirty and the faucets all needed to be replaced. The shower head sprayed water all over the place. The room smelled like it was a smoking room at one time and they sprayed a ton of chemicals to override the smokey smell. There are no safes in the rooms, which my company requires when we travel with a pc. The extra lock on the door was about to fall off and the furniture was old. I am usually an exclusive Hilton traveler and was thoroughly disappointed in this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: ang1968
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for a weekend game, and let me just say although the hotel is dated but seems to be going through some changes. The service more than makes up for it. Everyone in this hotel is beyond kind. They all go out of their way to make your stay pleasant. I just want to specifically point out the girls who work in the lounge on the 18th floor. Both ladies have been extremely kind to my husband and I...going beyond the call of duty...even when the were busy. Thanks to everyone for making us feel right at home!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs...... Poor customer service........”
Reviews.Author: Simple188
Reviews.Content: Moved to this hotel due to international conference. Not my first choice! For approximately three days, I was eaten alive by bed bugs. Ended up in the ER getting meds. It has been three months and I just healing up from it. I have been traveling for twenty years in and out of hotels. Never have I been treated this way. Thanks Hilton. Marriott here i come!

Reviews.Title: “gigantic corporate hilton property”
Reviews.Author: 53x11
Reviews.Content: only stayed for 1 night to take advantage of an amex promotion. adjacent self parking is $12/nt. did not get a chance to experience the executive lounge on 18th? floor (also the morning breakfast area), but perhaps should have because the starbucks snack shop at lobby level is spartan at best. very large lobby bar with plenty of flatscreen tv's. lobby restaurant was closed, after hours, on the visit. plentiful and friendly front desk staff. somewhat of an "island" like location, due to the major surrounding expressways. as mentioned previously, you'll need a car/shuttle ride to get to the galleria mall complex to the north.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Klug
Reviews.Content: This place is a nice and very typical Hilton. Nothing truly noteworthy. Self Parking was $12/night which was odd considering how far from downtown it was and there were miles of parking lots everywhere around it. The room was good sized for standard king and we were on a priceline stay so I am sure we did not get anything above the basic room. There was no view to speak of but this is the suburbs of Dalls, so I wasnt expecting much. The place does have some nice gardens and a small pond with a running trail around it, which is a very nice touch considering you cannot walk anywhere in Dallas. Lastly, the hotel shuttle to the Galleria was nice and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderfully staffed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lrah88
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Dallas on a last minute trip with my mother, and we stayed at the Hilton, Lincoln Centre. Despite the bad reviews that I've seen on this page, I would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff are just unbelievably friendly and welcoming- which comes part and parcel in Texas! I've seen a lot of the bad reviews are to do with travel and the state of the rooms... now I found the rooms to be typical of most Hilton hotels- they are comfortable above all else, and despite what you read here, they are most definitely clean! As for travel- Dallas, all of Texas and most of the States, is a car lead place. Public transport is available, but can be a bit confusing admittedly. However, there is a complimentary shuttle service run by the hotel, and the staff on the service are extraordinarily accommodating. As we were two women traveling alone, they went out of their way to help us, and always made sure that we were picked up exactly when and where we organized. I can honestly say that it is the staff who make this hotel, which is an unusual find in the Hilton chain. The concierge was magnificent and truly knew what he was talking about. There are an overwhelming amount of places to eat, drink and shop nearby, and I personally took great pleasure in strolling around the man-made lake at the rear of the hotel. Thank you to the staff for a wonderful stay, and I will most definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Indyhost
Reviews.Content: Awesome Lobby and Bar! Staff was out of Sight espically the Banquet Staff. A great hotel for a conference tons of meeting space ! Rooms were very nice I wish they had flat screens but other than that I can not complain nice area local shuttle that will take you anywhere within 3 miles and Customer Service was excellent!!!!! I would come back again !!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but restuarant & internet so so much...”
Reviews.Author: Bingenheimer
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel on business and the front desk and housekeeping staff were great. The lobby offers a comfortable bar and gathering area. The only issues were that the restuarant offers a lunch menu during dinner (wraps, sandwiches, etc.) and the internet access was consistently poor in both the guestrooms and meeting areas.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location but great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dodge4x4rules
Reviews.Content: Unless you are doing something at the Lincoln Center or don't plan to leave the hotel, the location is awful. You have to catch a (complimentary) shuttle even to go to the nearby mall and a cab to downtown is $40. The staff is amazing, the food is excellent, the outside pool/chaise lounge area is perfect for visiting with a friend and relaxing. The beds are comfortable, the towels are amazing... if it wasn't for the trouble getting to and from it, it would be a perfect stay. Even though we had an AWFUL Super Shuttle experience getting there, the hotel was so nice when we arrived and had cabs outdoors at all times so we didn't have to deal with the Super Shuttle again.

Reviews.Title: “Short and sweet review”
Reviews.Author: Electron
Reviews.Content: 5 star - Lobby, Conference and general service / Courtesy 3 star - Rooms, parking etc. ------------------------------------- Good for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if it were a $50 a night Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: farrahwhitaker
Reviews.Content: Comments: My husband and I frequent Hilton, Double Tree, and the Scurvin and usually love the hotels. But were very unhappy with Lincoln Center Hilton! We couldn't even take a bath for chipped poxy and mildew! It wasn't that it was dirty as much as it was old and in bad disrepair. We reserved the King Excutive but have stayed in better La Quinta's. This was in serious bad shape and couldn't believe that dispite the outside facade it was not nice at all. Plus the price! And everything is an BIG additional charge. Valet $20 a day. Internet-$12 per day, and one pot of coffee was $16!! I do not see how they have return visitors for the pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but needs upating”
Reviews.Author: ebladygolfer
Reviews.Content: We are just leaving this property after staying on Saturday and Sunday night. Loved the location and had no problem with getting to and from the property. The hotel rooms do need some major updating to keep up with other 4 stars that we stay in frequently. TV is horrible...not any fun watching the golf tournament on. Bathroom is small and needs to be gutted and start over. Biggest complaint we have is the paper thin walls. first night - we heard the couple next door 'enjoying' their evening. Second night - whoever was in the same room had their TV on all night very loud. We had to call security to get them to turn it off or down. Other than these 'con's' i agree with a previous poster....get the odd number room near the elevator. We had great view and room was nice other than the updating that it needed!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you're traveling on business”
Reviews.Author: RedRaider97
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for the past few months. Over this time I have come to see the pros/cons of this hotel. Before you read the nitty-gritty, I want you to know that I enjoy this hotel and actively seek it out when I come to Dallas. Overall, it's a nice hotel with a wonderful staff. If you get a good room rate it's definitely worth staying here. Pros: Nice rooms - the rooms are your standard hotel rooms. I have noticed that some rooms are better than others. If you can request it, ask for an odd numbered room. The hotel is curved shaped and I've noticed if you stay on the West side (odd numbers) of the hotel you get a bigger room. Recently I've been put on the East side (even numbers) and my room is noticeably smaller. Most recently I've been put at the end of the hallway and this is by far the smallest room. The poor room service guy can' hardly walk between the bed and the TV armoire. Since I mostly travel solo it's no big deal for me, but if I were traveling with my wife/small kids we'd have no room for the 2 playpens. Try to get a room closer to the elevator and on the West side of the hotel. Beds - I've been in about 15 different rooms while here at the hotel. Each one has had quality mattresses and pillows. Good room service - The room service food is excellent. I can only assume you'd get just as good food if you went to the restaurant downstairs. I'm just too lazy and like to do work and have my food brought to me. Nice gym - the gym looks like it was recently remodeled. They have a bike, a few stair-masters, 3 treadmills and some free weights. They also have some balance bubbles as well as medicine balls. Each exercise unit has a personal TV attached to it to help take your mind off of working out. They also have a nice pool. The best part is that all of their equipment is in working order. I have stayed at other hotels in the Dallas area (Hilton chains) and their exercise equipment wasn't always in working condition. Quiet - For the most part, I do not hear my neighbors. If someone is talking loudly I will hear them, but it's not like the walls are paper thin. Friendly Staff - everyone has been very helpful and made me feel welcome. I have not run into any rude staff members. Cons: Probably my biggest complaint about the hotel is the lack of a microwave. They have a mini-fridge, but no microwave. I'd like to be able to heat up leftovers sometimes. Also, if you have a small kid like we do, you wont be able to heat water to warm a bottle. Parking - self parking is $12 a day. It's not like they try to hide this from you, but just know going into it that you'll pay $12.99 a day extra to park. Also, the parking garage isn't exactly attached to the hotel. I've noticed that most people walk across the property to get to the garage (I did my first few weeks). However, there's a tunnel that connects the parking garage to the hotel. It's not all that well marked. Ask the front desk and they can point you in the right direction. This is a helpful thing to know, esp on a hot or rainy day. Traffic - the hotel is located at 2 major highway intersections (Tollway and 635). Getting into and out of the hotel can be tricky, especially during rush hour when everyone is doing 60 MPH on the access road while trying to get on/off the highway. I would hope it's better during the weekend, but during the week it can pose a challenge for those who are timid drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: I arrived after a stay at the Palomar in Philadelphia and this was a large hotel by comparison. I stayed there because it was attached to an office park where I had business. I was upgraded to a King mini suite and it was a huge room that was comfortably appointed. It had a kitchenette with a coffee / tea maker and two rooms. The bathroom was nicely appointed but small. A bathrobe and free water was supplied. The restaurant is open until 11pm and was very good. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: thekidsmom
Reviews.Content: Great location near Galleria. Def a Mon-Fri business hotel, as it was pretty empty during our stay (Thur/Fri nights). The redo in the lobby looks fantastic, but the sleeping rooms are indeed dated. But they are clean and quiet, so no complaints! Exec Lounge staff are friendly and helpful. Pool is bigger than expected and they have a nice very shallow (1 ft) pool perfect for infants.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service from the front desk to all others on executive floors”
Reviews.Author: Coach012
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Hilton many times before, but upon arriving, this Hilton is exceptional. Kyle at the front desk was extremely well mannered as well as professional in every way. He went out of his way to make sure that everything was exactly as I had asked when I made the reservation. This is why Hilton is above a four diamond as far as I am concerned----because of employees such as Kyle. The room on the nineteenth floor was super. The breakfast in the morning and the food in the afternoon was excellent as well as both young ladies (Ladna in the morning and Christine in the afternoon) who could do nothing more to make all of us comfortable. They are both models for what a concieerge should be. This property is extremely well run and extremely clean. A wonderful experience!!!! San Antonio, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Shallow pool, NO HOT TUB! $12 for...”
Reviews.Author: AmericanDad1
Reviews.Content: Shallow pool, NO HOT TUB! $12 for parking! lobby was extravagant and nice but room was dated and average quality. No free breakfast! This was not the best deal around. Outside and nice lobby set expectations very high only to be let down by the low quality rooms and pool.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: platanita4
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night in this hotel but it was very comfy and enjoyable. I'd gladly stay again. It's extremely close to the Galleria, but you do need a car in order to get there. I chose this hotel based on the proximity to shopping, a car dealership, and the airport. Not a bad choice. We had a wonderful room on the eighth floor overlooking the fountains. The staff at the front desk and at the valet service was very nice and glad to be of service. Highly recommendable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wish there were more like them.”
Reviews.Author: BlaiseCrosby
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in excellent condition (recently remodeled) with a dramatic all-glass exterior and an attractive, spacious lobby. Check-in was brief and efficient and the room passed "the wife test," which is to say she was pleased with the appearance. Agree that a mini-fridge and microwave would have been nice, especially for those restaurant leftovers. The beds are indeed "firm," neither soft nor hard. After a vending machine ate $2, the front desk very kindly waived one day's worth of self parking. The self-parking is a short distance away from the hotel and quite manageable. Another reviewer made mention that the clientele was mainly business travelers, which is probably true, but we did see some families and couples here and there. There were a few discreet events going on (receptions and a baby shower), but nothing loud. There is a small snack bar that serves Starbucks coffee/baked goods, but it isn't open all day and it does not have the full Starbucks menu. Location is convenient to the highways and to the Galleria, but nothing is really within walking distance. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGuyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 2 nights for a conference. Just to walk through the basics: Location: great location right off the freeway. It is considered "North Dallas" but downtown is only a 15-20 minute ride away. The location is a built-up area that seems like it has a lot to offer (even though we didn't go out exploring too much). Rooms: rooms were very clean and spacious. Beds very comfortable. No flat screen tv's or anything too special, but the hallways and rooms do have a comfortable and luxurious feel to them. Staff: everyone seemed friendly. Lady who checked me in offered two twin beds at first but was more than happy to find a king bed room for me when asked. Food: we ate at Crockett's restaurant one night and the food was very good. Had a steak and it was cooked perfectly and delicious. All-in-all I would recommend this hotel for business travelers or anyone looking for a safe and clean place to stay. There were several conferences taking place while we were there. Great atmosphere. The one criticism I would have is that they made you pay for wireless internet in the room. I guess this is a fairly common practice these days (except for certain hotel chains - Marriott Courtyard, etc) Kinda bugs you a little when you pay so much for the rooms. But not a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, service, staff, location at a wonderful price!”
Reviews.Author: NanaMexia
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Hilton Lincoln Center for a girls' weekend. I had read mixed reviews so wasn't really sure about what to expect. Upon arrival we were greeted with friendly staff and that continued throughout our stay. Check-in was painless. Randy was great in getting our reservation for a great restaurant. Although the rooms need a little update, the were very clean and large and the beds comfy.

Reviews.Title: “No Room in the Gym”
Reviews.Author: tarheeldeb
Reviews.Content: First of all, I will say I cannot imagine why anyone would stay in this hotel unless they have to for business. With that said, I will mention the positives: I like hard beds, and found the beds to be hard and comfortable. If, like some of my coworkers, you prefer soft beds, you are out of luck. The pillows were also comfortable. The room was fairly quiet, and although I was on the 16th floor, I never had to wait long for an elevator. Internet access was expensive but fairly reliable. Now the negatives: I guess they still allow some smoking in this hotel. I was on a supposed no smoking floor, but my room and the hallways smelled faintly of stale cigarettes. I was assigned a room with two double beds - I can't remember the last time I slept in a double bed. I am very tall and find queen or king to be much more comfortable. The TV was small and of the picture tube variety. Most TV stations did not come in very well. No bath robe in the room - I hate that. The gym was tiny and totally inadequate for a hotel with 20 floors. The gym consisted of 4 treadmills, two ellipticals, a bike and miscellaneous free weights. I had to go to the gym late at night to get a treadmill/elliptical. When I complained at the desk, I was told the gym was not normally busy, and it was just unfortunate that I was there at the same time as a meeting with a bunch of young guys. There is another gym in LIncoln Center, but the Hilton did not offer free guest passes to irate guests. Hilton guests can use the other gym for a price. I like to work out in the mornings, but could not get a treadmill at 6 am during my 4 days at the Hilton. Restaurant selection in this hotel is dismal - not much to choose from. It was very inconvenient to have to leave the hotel every night for a decent meal at a reasonable price. The hotel has shuttle service to the mall once an hour. Which brings me to another big problem for this hotel - it is totally isolated in the middle of the highway. You cannot walk anywhere without crossing a highway. This Hilton was not even ideal for a meeting - the first day of our meeting we had constant problems with the audio system. The meeting rooms were noisy - there was a lot of foot traffic on the tile floors in the hallway outside the room. Consideration should be given to carpeting the hallway. Overall, I could not believe this hotel is part of the Hilton chain. Although lately I find myself saying that about quite a few hotels in other once upscale chains as well. Is it a sign of the times that these hotel chains are letting quality slip?

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Charis16
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice - once in December and once in January so I will lump the reviews together. They are remodeling - it covered the entrances and lobby when we were there in December but has since cleared out and now the lobby looks nice. They fall in with everyone else in this area (haven't found anyone with free self-park or a decently priced valet) with parking. It was $20 for valet and $12 for self park in their garage. FYI to a tip I received - they are in a kind of business center so there is other parking it is just not theirs so you can park without paying but you do so at your own risk of tickets/towing. I've parked else where twice with no problems. The December check-in was uneventful. The January check-in was irritating because after being questioned if we were parking with them (we answered no) they said that the self park fee would be added to our room at which we again insisted we were not parking with them. Instead of letting it go the person then begins to lecture us about towing/tickets - not their parking lot - I tuned him out after the first few minutes. It was a bad enough spill (I'm sure they have to tell you but the delivery of this message needs to be improved) that it upset me for a good rest of the evening because the delivery makes you feel as if you are stupid and not capable of assessing the risk and reading the signs in the parking lot. We got our keys after a nice little bit of this speech and went to our room. The rooms are decent. There are not any bugs and they are clean. My one pet peeve is that a hotel that lists itself as 4 star has no fridge, microwave or extra amenities. They even charge a pretty penny for their internet which is not even competitve (makes me feel like they are trying to squeeze me for money) because there are other hotels in the area that do not charge or charge much less. Plus starbucks is right up the street or at the mall for free wifi - these rooms are not nice enough to make me want to stay and pay for the internet. In conclusion the outside, lobby and entrance are much more immpressive than the rooms and if you are looking for a clean place to sleep with a coffee maker and nothing else - this is it. However anything else (fridge, microwave, decent TV, safe, etc) look elsewhere. I may go back for those one night stays when I am passing through but any more than one night and I will be looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are in terrible need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: Living_well_2009
Reviews.Content: Donâ€™t get taken in by the low price- yes the hotel has a convenient location, but the rooms are very dated and donâ€™t measure up to the star rating. The hotel is in the process of renovating. However until that is completed, save yourself disappointment and stay someplace else. Apologies from management are appreciated but the donâ€™t change the current condition of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worst room I have stayed in in years and I travel a lot.”
Reviews.Author: jddubya
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for location and thought it would have nice rooms. The room they gave me on the 16th floor was very bad. It has not been renovated in many many years. Everything from the carpet to the furnishings to the outdated TV to the bathroom was pretty bad. I called the front desk to see if they had any renovated rooms and was told room renovation wouldn't start until later in 2010. Until they renovate the rooms in a year or two, not a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time ....in our suite!!!!”
Reviews.Author: STLfan420
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here, just to get out of the house. We ended up getting a suite on the 12th floor that over looks the lake. The room was huge. When you walk in, there is a little kitchen area that has a fridge, microwave and a sink. There was even a dinning table to set all of our stuff on. Then there is the living room, that had a huge corner couch and the blinds open up to a entire wall that is a window. The bedroom had a awesome bed and another table and chairs. The bathroom had a jetted tub and a shower. The toilet was in a separate room in the bathroom which was nice when we are both in there in the morning. Needless to say the room was amazing and we were there last Thursday night when all the OU fans and alums were checking in. We met some really cool people in town for the game. We went to go eat at Cricket's but there was not a lot of stuff on the menu to choose from so we asked our waiter, and he gave us a few options that were close by, were we could go. He really didn't have to do that, but it was really nice of him. Since we both have been drinking for a few hours up in the room, we decided to just go back up to the room and order room service. I had the bacon cheese burger ( on a wheat bun) which really hit the spot. My wife had the crab and avocado salad, which she loved and could not stop talking about. So we just sat up in the room, ate and watched the entire Season 5 of "Curb your Enthusiasm" which we brought along with a portable DVD player. Most of the movies that the hotel had, we already have seen. It is always good to have a back up plan. The total of the room service was $45.00, but I would pay that any day to spend a quite and very romantic evening with my wonderful wife. The next morning, I woke up before my wife and I wanted to be a nice husband and go get her breakfast and bring it back up to the room for her so she could have breakfast in bed. Well, I went down there and they said I could not bring it up to the room...Oh Well. On my way back up to the room to wake up my wife, I stopped by the Starbucks right by the lobby and picked up 2 Caramel Macchiato's and went to wake up my wife. Then we went to breakfast at the downstairs restaurant. It was a buffet thing and it was like $17.00 each. It was a good thing I got vouchers for a free breakfast. I mean, I'm glad it was free, but the food was really good for a hotel breakfast. It was all the same stuff the other hotels have, it was just better. I think it was the bacon, it was really good. It had crispy edges and the center was still soft. The Belgium waffles were good as well. Overall, the stay was great and whenever my wife and I need a night away from everything....this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRWB1960
Reviews.Content: This had everything I needed for my business trip to Dallas. Good location convenient check in/check out quiet room with great bed excellent in-room coffee maker. Funny the parking was comped for me. I asked about it at the desk and they gave me a pass. The restaurant/bar was actually decent and the lobby quite nice. It's not a resort or a grand city hotel, but it is a solid upscale place for business travel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “An okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cangsgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful on the pictures but when we got there the room was not what we expected. We've stayed at Hilton's before in other ciities but this one didn't keep us in that luxury. We had double beds which were very small but on the positive side slept well. No microfridge so we called down and asked if we could rent one and it was delievered after we left(for ($25 for your entire stay). When we returned there was only a fridge not a microwave and we called down to see where the microwave was and the guy didn't even know what a microfridge was...he said the girl must have misunderstood what we meant even though we asked if they had a microfridge or a minifridge and her answer was microfridge. Parking was $12 a day. Good thing we only paid $52/night courtesy of hotwire or else we would have really been upset! The tv was a little smaller than we expected and the bathroom was outdated. THe only good thing was the shower was pretty good and the housekeeping was awesome! The housekeeper never knocked on the door even though we didn't have the do not disturb sign out and our room was always cleaned after we left no matter what time it was...Hilton please update your amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Got the job done”
Reviews.Author: Ribbit99
Reviews.Content: I've driven by the Hilton at Lincoln Centre countless times during travels to Dallas. Right off of 635 and across the highway from the Galleria, this hotel is in a very convenient location for many attractions in the Metroplex. When I received a fantastic rate on this hotel through Hotwire, I was really excited to finally stay at what looks like a very posh hotel from the interstate. The lobby is quite grand and the staff were courteous, but there was really nothing posh or spectacular about the room itself. The bed was comfortable and I enjoyed the in-room Cuisinart coffee maker. However, the bathroom was a little disappointing with towels so worn you could see right through them in places and the lukewarm water in the shower. Parking was $12 for the night. Honestly - I'd stay here again only if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: txninja
Reviews.Content: This was the second Hilton that we stayed in over the course of 30 days, and of the two this one was much more professional and in general we walked away from this hotel much happier than the last. We received excellent pricing thanks to Priceline. The hotel had a very elegant look and feel to it. We were greeted warmly at the front desk and were pleasantly surprised by the accommodations. It was strange that they had a rather old TV in the room, but we weren't really there to watch television. Beds were very comfortable. The pool was nice, although not great mainly due to how shallow it was in most areas. The fitness room had good quality equipment. We only had breakfast at the restaurant and it was rather good. I recommend the Spanish migas. The aesthetics of hotel were top notch. We had an enjoyable time walking the diameter of the small lake next to the hotel. The ducks that also enjoy the lake took a walk with us. The internet and parking was not free. If we had not gotten such a good deal on the hotel the parking rate would have bothered me, but I understand the need to charge being that the place was in Lincoln Centre. The hotel was basically across the street from the Galleria mall. We did not actually visit the mall on this particular trip, but it is an excellent place to shop and the hotel offers an hourly shuttle to and from the location. I would stay there again if we could lock in on the same great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: iKenneth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel on priceline. For what we paid the hotel was a steal. There are two reasons I didn't give it 5 stars. One is we weren't particularly impressed with the breakfast. Their buffet didn't even reach the standard of 2 star hotel. The other is that the hotel overall didn't quite reach the level of a 4 star hotel. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable but it was just the little things like the bathrooms (both in room and in common areas) didn't look like they'd been updated in years. However, they were clean and functioned well. The TV was the old sort you wouldn't expect in a hotel of this level. Despite this we had a very nice stay here and the cost of staying at this hotel (especially through Priceline) is extremely good.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and DImed and just OK”
Reviews.Author: hoopsmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughter July 10-12 over a weekend. The room was nice enough, just as pictured. The Interior is nice enough. Like others, I got a great price on Hotwire and it is a good thing because they charge $12.00 per night for parking. The ticket machine in the parking garage ran out of tickets Sat morning and from then on the gate was just open. They still charged me. Don't take the promise of a shuttle anywhere within 3 mi. too seriously - each time we tried to use it there was at least a 40 minute wait - so we wound up just driving. The trouble is they had two guys working both the Valet stand AND the shuttle. They do keep the hourly run over to the mall. The strangest thing to me was there is NO coffee service in the lobby. My room only had decaf and I didn't want to wake my family so I went downstairs thinking every hotel has coffee in the lobby - not this one! A 4 star hotel and no coffee in the lobby??? Its a silly thing but it struck me as cheap after being nickeled and dimed over parking and Internet. It was just OK - if prices were about the same - I'd choose the Westin across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: l7r123
Reviews.Content: With the price and name of Hilton you would expect higher quality-NOT SO! From paying from parking to paying for basic things like Internet this hotel may be eye candy but you'll pay for everything! Even the normal things that we have come to expect from Hilton like breakfast you'll walk away paying $15.00. Expect to come out of pocket $45.00 for parking and breakfast every day. When questioned the staff act like this is normal for any hotel. This hotel is a major rip off for the area and staff are rude. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Friendly Staff. Parking Garage and Fee Not Fun”
Reviews.Author: Nick007FSU
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights during the business week and everything was fine. The hotel was given to me through Priceline, so the price was good. Everything about the amenities, staff and lobby were above average. The rooms were average with no free wi-fi, small TVs and no HD. I believe a true 4 star hotel needs HD in every room. The parking garage and underground walkway were ok, but the walk to room elevators was long and the parking fee of $12 per day is excessive. I would recommend if you are ok with no HD, no wi-fi and the parking situation.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjgatto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a business trip. Pricelined and got a steal for the price. I was a little nervous reading some of the reviews saying priceline customers get the worst rooms in the hotel. If my room was the worst, I would love to see the better rooms. Large bed, nice desk, quiet, great view of the expressway, and spacious area. The bathroom could use some updating, but it was not terrible. The restaurant was expensive, but good. The staff was friendly and helpful. Plus, there was a Starbucks in the lobby. There was a high price for the parking, but if you are in a rental or company car, you can park down the street for free and walk the half mile back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what comes to mind when staying at a Hilton...”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A
Reviews.Content: You would think that things would be a little more upscale with something with the name, Hilton attached to it (except for Paris of course). I stood here for a week for business and had to change my room three times because the air conditioning was not working. Then when I finally got a room where the air conditioner was working, there was a bunch of black stuff coming out of the vent! The bathroom fixtures are very outdated. I had not seen fixtures like that since the 80's. Since my room got changed three times I got to see different views from the hotel, the views from the guest rooms are spectacular. If you order room service there is a filet mignon that comes with mashed potatoes and asparagus that is to die for. The parking garage is a walk from the hotel grounds. It gets really dark at night and the walk from the garage to the hotel is pretty creepy if you are alone. Personally, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WATravelers005
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, but still lovely and kept up well. I loved the service. Our first room had water on the bathroom floor - they moved us right up the hall in less than two minutes. A lamp quit working, it was repaired and returned in five minutes. It was not too noisy at any point, and our stay was from Friday through Monday. Employees were friendly and very helpful. Being from a coffee drinking area, I was more than disappointed that their coffee stand was closed on weekends. The food was good in the on-site restaurants, but a tad pricey. I was really very impressed with the level of service. It is near the Galleria and they provide free shuttle service there and back. It is not near downtown Dallas, but if you are brave enough to drive the freeways, you have relatively quick access to everything. A comfortable and great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, great shopping location”
Reviews.Author: jjuliannaa
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. The lobby was quiet, and the staff was very friendly. The beds were comfortable. This was great hotel for shopping. They offer a free shuttle to the Galleria Mall on the hour. It is also near ValleyView Mall and was about a 10 minute drive to North Park Mall. The room was clean, but the bathroom was in need of an update. The finish on the tub was worn, but was in fair condition. I only mention it because so many hotels now have awesome bathrooms. We booked the bed and breakfast package. The breakfast buffet was at Crockett's on the pool level. It was amazing! The food was good and the service was perfect. They had standard breakfast items, and a cook to prepare omelets or eggs any style. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “functional for business”
Reviews.Author: bigbaldjohnny
Reviews.Content: Arrival: Front desk is efficient and helpful. Room: A bit long in the tooth. Rooms on the "highway" side can be noisy but larger. The back side rooms are smaller but reasonable and quiet (if a university sports team is not on your floor...) The TV's, even on the exec floors need to be updated to flat panels. My room also had a fridge. The bath is small and showed assorted water damage and rust was visible. Staff: I never got room service, but $3.00 delivery charge plus 18% tip seemed a bit much for a glass of juice and a toast. The staff in the executive lounge was great in the evening. Ask for Dallas dining advise. Housekeeping and turn down service was unreliable. Food: Service in the one eating place I visited was terrible, my drink tasted like the bar rag and the food was marginal. Other amenities: Pool - too cold in December. Workout room is minimal. Parking is expensive and a long walk. The lobby and common areas are attractive. Checkout : Fast and easy my bill was accurate the morning of departure.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Crescoia
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to meet the person who just might be the friendliest hotel staffer you'll ever meet. Jaki who worked the executive lounge the days we were there is in a catagory of here own. Greeting guest with a smile and positive attitude, she got many compliments from the guest in the lounge. If you picked up a roll or bread item she was right there to ask if she could warm it for you, if you brought breakfast items to the table and she noticed you didn't pick up a spoon she was right behind you with one (I saw this happen a couple times). If the crowd got large and she came close to getting overwhelmed taking care of them all she would hurry about telling you how blessed she is to have this many guests in the lounge. Truely a wonder, any service industry would love to have a Jaki. As you can infer, we stayed on the executive level and unless she rotates around this would limit how many guests would get to interact with her, but those that do I am sure will admire her and enjoy the experience. Although not at the way above the call of duty level that Jaki had set, all the other employees we came in contact with including the front desk, bellman and car valet were all pleasent and cheerful also.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly front desk employees”
Reviews.Author: falltripper
Reviews.Content: The room and other facilities in this hotel were nice. I found the parking attendants and other workers helpful. The problem I encountered was with 2 of the women who worked the front desk. When I had a question about my bill, which I communicated very calmly, the first woman I spoke with was difficult. She was not willing to discuss my question and was very abrupt in her response. When I asked to talk to the manager, another woman came over (not the manager) and was equally unhelpful. She sent me to talk to another employee, who was very considerate and cleared up the problem immediately. He also called the front desk, in my presence, and explained the situation. When I went back to the front desk for an amended bill, the same 2 women refused, saying they did not receive a phone call. (Basically, accusing me of lying.) Instead of asking around, they just kept refusing to print the amended bill. Finally, another worker overheard them and came over. She told them she had received the phone call and everything was fine. For a hotel of this caliber, I would have expected more graciousness and hospitality from the front desk. There are many hotel choices in Dallas, and I will not be choosing this one again on my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: cheers-to-travel
Reviews.Content: I've grown up traveling to Dallas very often, and this hotel has been a long favorite of my family. Now, I travel to Dallas at least once per year for business. I've stayed at many hotels in Dallas with my company, but this hotel is my favorite - especially for shopping trips. The hotel has a free shuttle to the Galleria that leaves every hour. This amenity is fabulous! Also, the hotel is relatively close to Northpark Mall and the Highland Park area - which has great restaurants. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. The bedding is typical for a Hilton - crisp white and very soft. I'm a Hilton Honors member, and this hotel is on par with other great Hiltons where I've stayed. The staff are very nice and accomodating. I always prefer this hotel when I travel to Dallas, and I would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suppiluliomas
Reviews.Content: It is a typical business oriented hotel: shiny large lobby, conference rooms, posh restaurants, and rather small but okay and clean rooms. Never mind, I enjoyed staying with the family for a couple of nights. The kids loved the spaceous pool. Breakfast buffet was superb. Though I had a bit of a run-in with the waiter when he pointed out that we as a family of four had only two b'fast vouchers. I asked him whether my kids were supposed to starve, or whether two people had to watch the other two eating. I don't know why we had only two vouchers and I wasn't in the mood to make much fuzz about it. Don't get the wrong impression: I was immediately offered the deal that only one extra breakfast was charged and the restaurant staff was very friendly and competent. Overall, I was very satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: AustLesConner
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel right by great shopping in Dallas. The room was very large with plenty of room. Nice service and nice breakfast as well.
