The parking was a little confusing but it wouldn't cause us to not stay here again. If you're headed to the Galleria - this is a nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMTULSA
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through Priceline for half of the usual cost for a room with two double beds. Great location, nice rooms, cable in room, and internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton was nice for a night away from home”
Reviews.Author: britterich
Reviews.Content: We live in Dallas but my husband and I wanted a night away from home for our 17th anniversary. I can't complain about the price - $96/night including taxes through Priceline and the hotel is beautiful. Initially we packed "in back" because we didn't want to pay to park and upon check-in Katie was very helpful and polite yet when she inquired about where we parked she gave us a tag for parking and we were told there was no charge. We were surpised to see that we were charged $10.83 for parking. When we called the front desk the girl proceeded to argue with my husband. Another person at the front desk eventually removed the charge. I understand that there is office buildings next to the Hilton and they do need to charge yet it would have been nice to been given accurate information from the beginning. If you're looking to watch TV there are few channels yet not a huge issue unless you're looking for more than 15-20 channels. The room was beautiful and the bedding made it easy to sleep in late. (Even my husband with a bad back was able to sleep.) The room was very clean and comfortable. There was some mildrew and grout issue in the tub area and the tub would not hold water (we had to use a wash cloth over the drain) and other small cosmetic issues but in all it was very nice. I wouldn't consider it bad enough to not recommend staying there again. The pool area was very nice with very comfortable chaise lounges. We did not use the workout facilities but walked through there and it was very nice and appeared to all be in working order. In all it's a great location and once you get there the first time, it's a breeze. The confusion is more due to the street/highway layout than anything the hotel could control. I would stay there again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: FamilyManEastTexas
Reviews.Content: Hotel and rooms were clean. Nice outdoor pool for the kids including a "baby pool." Cardio equipment was good quality. Dumbbells and pully weights were adequate for a weekend workout. Staff where helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hilton that WORKS FOR ME!”
Reviews.Author: shuzkelly
Reviews.Content: Good location, but tricky off-ramps/on-ramps (Google or MapQuest VERY CAREFULLY ~ after you do it once, it's easy!) Amazingly good food for a hotel (room service) Decent Mexican, great soup, FAST. Easy to borrow computers in the lobby. Clean, except for a little grout issues in bathtub. Sweet maid w/ good attitude. Near an upscale mall w/ ice skating called the Galleria. We toured both TCU and SMU from here...watch those left hand fwy exits if you are not familiar with Dallas/Texas traffic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Christy34
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January for 8 days and just now got around to writing a review because I've been traveling for work as usual. I loved it, and that's pretty much all there is to say. But I'll say more. Upon check-in, a dairk haired female was so polite and used my name several times. She said "Welcome back," since I had stayed there once this year and have a Hilton membership. She offered me an upgrade, and a bellman promptly walked me to my room. The room was open and airy. The bed linens were crisp, and I took a nap before my first meeting. I ordered a cesar salad from room service after that, and the agent was also very nice. The food at this place wsa great throughout my stay. One day for breakfast I had the eggs benedict, and it reminded me of a dish I once had in my childhood. Upon checkout, over the phone, the guy asked me how my stay was. Housekeeping was great I said, the staff was all friendly, and my room was comfortable. I didn't want to go back to GA.

Reviews.Title: “very good experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CMurrayDundeeUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights while touring through Texas. Located to the north of the city but convenient for attractions (if you have a car). we did the JFK museum in downtown Dallas before heading over to Fort Worth Stockyards and then to Southfork Ranch so you can do these attractions in a day from this base. Nice restaurants and other facilities. Excellent well appointed room at very competitive rate. Overall a very good experience and would recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Dallas Lincoln Centre
HotelInfo.Address: 5410 LBJ Freeway, Dallas, TX 75240-6276
